text: Aqua Munda is a mod that extends ImmersiveCraft and adds the concept of
fresh water and various things that you can do with that (like cooking).
The water you can find in the normal world is too dirty or salty to actually use for
many purposes. That's why Aqua Munda adds ways to make fresh water.
Fresh water can be collected (from tanks) with a bucket and you can also place it in the world.
However, you cannot get infinite fresh water sources and fresh water source blocks are also
two ways to get fresh water:
To collect rain water you need to place some empty tanks in the open.
When it rains these tanks will collect fresh water

Aqua Munda has various blocks that you can use. All of them allow you to use them without having to access a GUI.
A hose is a semi flexible pipe that can transport liquids.
Just place them down and it will automatically connect to compatible devices.
With these two blocks you can convert normal water to fresh water.
To use this multiblock you can use hoses to transfer normal water to the desalinator.
Then you can use another hose to transfer the fresh water to another tank.
The desalinator will automatically work but very slow. To speed it up you can put a fire
under it (for example, using sticks). That will speed up the evaporation process.
The sprinkler can be used to speed up growth of crops. It does need fresh water which you can
Tanks are a multiblock that can contain liquids. You can use buckets to put in or out liquids.
A tank that is visible to the sky will collect fresh water when it rains.
Note however that water will evaporate slowly if it is sunny.
The grinder is a block that can be used to grind wheat into flour.
Just put the wheat on the grinder and then right click it to start grinding.
